data.title: [TRACKER] Drag & Drop related issues
data.body:
### This is a tracker for drag drop related issues:
- [x] Drag and Drop reparenting bug https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4712 (bug)
- [x] Bug with drag&drop in the Scene tab https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4628 (bug)
- [x] D&D Incorrect new index when arranging children in Scene Tree https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4633 (bug)
- [x] D&D FileSystem error on moving gdscript file to another folder https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4786 (bug)
- [x] AutoLoad, Drag and Drop https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3543 (feature request)
- [x] D&D to re-order tabs https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/1030 (feature request)
- [ ] FileSystem drag and drop can easily lead to missing dependencies issues #5684 (bug)
- [ ] D&D Ability to reorder scripts in script view https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4775 (feature request)
- [x] drag/drop meshes into viewport #4945 (feature request)
- [ ] D&D a node from the scene panel, into a gdscript to get its path https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2505 (feature request)

data.title: Remote Inspector: ability to inspect memeber variables as well
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1 alpha
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Remote inspector would be even more handy if it would allow not only to inspect exported variables, but 'normal' ones as well.

data.title: Fix #4748: proper call to base class function
data.body: I guess this was left to change after "member_functions" was changed from GDFunction to GDFunction*.

data.title: Best practices for gamedev - use cache
data.body:
SCons allows to cache built files -
http://scons.org/doc/latest/HTML/scons-user/ch24.html
which is very useful in shared development with a lot of resources
to be built. It helps to speedup workflow in teams and can be
useful for Godot developers / extender teams as well

data.title: README.md docs are not wiki
Editor doesn't reload changed resources.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux 64bit - Godot 2.1 alpha compiled with b2a4908e9cc802a838a67f92dd66a17d3894c619

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

The editor doesn't reload changed resources generated by ResourceSaver.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a resource and save it with ResourceSaver in script (`version 1`).
2. Open the resource with editor it seems everything is fine.
3. Create another different resource and save it to the same path (`version 2`).
4. Open the overwrited resource you can see it still be the `version 1`.
5. Check the resource file with other text editor, it is correct.
6. Reopen the project and open the resource file , it will show `version 2`

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0AolAabr5edbXpEZkVnVXRXRTA/view

data.title: _init arg count errors inheritance error
data.body:
OS Windows, latest commit

Seems to be an issue most-likely introduced by the new script profiling tools since it only appears to be introduced fairly recently. Certain instantiated GDScript objects with inherited '_init' statements (func _init(args).(parent_args)) will fail with the error message: 'Invalid call to function '_init'. Expected 0 arguments.' Subsequent, attempts to rerun the game project will result in the '0' gradually increasingly randomly, 'Invalid call to function '_init'. Expected 78 arguments.', 'Invalid call to function '_init'. Expected 32758 arguments.', ect., until it finally 'presumably' overflows and gives the error 'Bug, call error: #699553309'. I'm not sure if any of the example projects contain code to reproduce such an error, but for an example, try running the similarly complex Tanks of Freedom project (https://github.com/w84death/Tanks-of-Freedom) to see it reproduced.

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from godotengine/master
data.body: rebase with master

data.title: README: little improvements
data.body:
The move was over three months ago, it is irritating
to still read "has been moved to".

data.title: Polygon2D now exposes vertex colors.
data.body: The original Color property is now the default color for unspecified vertices, to preserve compatibility with the old behavior.

data.title: StreamPlayer Playback Bug
data.body:
**Windows 7, 64 - bit - Godot version: Godot_v2.0.3_stable_win64.exe**

**Issue description** When playing back an already loaded resource (.ogg stream player) the sound is delayed / plays at unexpected times

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[playbug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/276667/playbug.zip)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Import the project, and click the play button several times. You will notice even after you wait until the stream is finished playing, and clicking the button again it **sometimes** doesn't play. But, if you spam click the button, the sound only plays at weird intervals. Or, if you wait for 3 seconds, 2, or 5 seconds it plays correctly. It's very weird and I'm not sure how else to explain it :8ball: 

Also, the sound file is only 1 second long, the length of the sound has no effect. I tested this on a 30 second long sound file and it's the same results

data.title: Change the default comment color to #676767
data.body:
A neutral gray color, more readable than the old brown one.

The current brown color is not very readable, especially on screens with a poor contrast ratio.

Example:

![Example screenshot](https://lut.im/BbCeCz0pkm/7dtkEYelQduE9lh4.png)

data.title: Change low processor usage mode to cap to 60 FPS rather than 40 FPS
data.body: This results in smoother operation in the editor, without needing to resort to the "Update Always" method which uses more resources than needed.

data.title: "Directory" class provide confusing "." and ".." output
data.body:
Godot 2.0.3 windows7x64

We have Directory class. (http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_directory.html)

and along with normal output it produce '.' and '..' as available directories.

Code from documentation illustrates this behaviour.

``` python
func dir_contents(path): 
    var dir = Directory.new()
    if dir.open(path) == OK:
        dir.list_dir_begin()
        var file_name = dir.get_next()
        while (file_name != ""):
            if dir.current_is_dir():
                print("Found directory: " + file_name)
            else:
                print("Found file: " + file_name)
            file_name = dir.get_next()
    else:
        print("An error occurred when trying to access the path.")
```

call  of  dir_contents("res://")

will make this result:

Found directory: .
Found directory: ..
Found directory: .git
Found file: arena.scn
Found directory: assets
...and so on

This may be unexpected when someone is trying to recursively walk over the directory tree (and ends with path like res://././././././.   )

Of course it is easy to workaround by adding some checks like 
if(file_name != ".." && file_name != "."):

I assume that something in godot relies on such behavior. But since 'Directory' class is part of public API for work with filesystem, this behaviour is quite confusing and output should not contain '.' and '..' by default.

data.title: If scene or script files is not saved because of error, editor doesn't display this error.
data.body:
Godot 2.0.3(steam) windows7x64

Sometimes I'm unable to save my changes in scenes and .gd scripts for unknown reason. In this case I see this error in console:

SAVING: res://splash.scn
ERROR: FileAccessWindows::close: Condition ' rename_error ' is true.
   At: drivers\windows\file_access_windows.cpp:135

But editor behaves like everything is OK. I usually notice this when doing a lot of changes in scripts and run this scripts to see effect. Sometimes I edit scripts when game is running or stopped under debugger, then I save my changes and restart the game. And sometimes I don't see that my changes are applied. In this case I usually see this error in console.

I'm not sure why that error happens and under what conditions. Maybe FS problems. Maybe hardware problems. Maybe SourceTree is scanning changes and interfere with godot. Maybe a bug. So I can't provide steps to reproduce that error.

Since I don't know if this is a bug in godot or a problem of my system, I have a feature request instead. If save error happens, please, show it in UI, so user could know that his work is not saved and he could try again.

data.title: Inherited scenes: float variables always seen as custom, can't be reset
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All OSs, Godot 2.0.3 and master.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
In inherited scenes (at least using the TSCN format), float variables appear to always be seen as custom (thus with a button to reset them), and resetting them has no effect:
![spectacle b13401](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/15455662/5171eb5c-205b-11e6-85e7-2b0173493ab3.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Load provided minimal project
2. Check the KinematicBody2D in the inspector: the Margin is shown as modified, even though it has the exact same value as in the base scene.

**Link to minimal example project**:
[bug_inheritance_reinit.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/276506/bug_inheritance_reinit.zip)

data.title: Values initalized to -0 on conversion/export to TRES format
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Any OS, Godot 2.0.3 and master.

**Issue description**

When exporting a tileset to the TRES format, some values (typically default `Vector2` assignements) are saved with a value of -0, i.e. `Vector2( -0, -0 )`. When resaving the resource from the inspector, this bug is fixed and the values are changed to `Vector2( 0, 0 )`.

Excerpt from the related diff:

```
 0/texture = ExtResource( 1 )
 0/tex_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 0/region = Rect2( 0, 0, 64, 128 )
-0/occluder_offset = Vector2( -0, -0 )
-0/navigation_offset = Vector2( -0, -0 )
-0/shape_offset = Vector2( -0, -0 )
+0/occluder_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
+0/navigation_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
+0/shape_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 0/shapes = [ SubResource( 1 ) ]
 1/name = "Floor2"
```

**Link to minimal example project**

See this example project that reproduces the bug: [bug_zeros.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/276497/bug_zeros.zip)

data.title: To use env_drivers in proper situations in drivers/SCsub.
Instancing inner classes directly from 'preload()' gives errors in editor, but works.
data.body:
Godot 2.0.3 - Windows7x64    

This line of code works, but give an error in the editor.
var inner = preload("res://HasInnerClass.gd").InnerClass.new()
![gdinnertest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10543859/15455377/ea6aad86-205a-11e6-9276-9f4009b9d6c3.png)

example project: https://github.com/Biliogadafr/Godot-Tests/tree/master/InnerInit

If project is reopened all seems OK again.
So in example project to see the bug you need to change inner class name for example to InnerClasssss

Maybe this is just a misuse. but also it looks like bug so... let it be reported :)
As workaround preload() result should be placed in variable and inner class should be made from this variable.  (in my case it was necessary to create only one variable from inner class  so I decided to write that in one line and got this error).

data.title: Disable Ctrl+D when editing a script
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

In Godot Ctrl+D is used to duplicate node. Into other applications it is used to duplicate lines.

So, it happens that when I'm editing a script, my reflex is to press Ctrl+D instead of Ctrl+B, and I end up confused because I duplicated a node somewhere.

Ctrl+D is useless when editing scripts.

So it would be cool if it was disabled when editing scripts, or if it was working as an alias of Ctrl+B.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Nodes from a parent Control that are  children of a sprite don't inherit that Controls Theme
data.body:
Hard to explain, but look at my hierarchy for example:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/15453997/edbbd60c-1fdf-11e6-9760-6afe604215ea.png)

On this image, the `Button` and `Checkbox` nodes inherit the main theme. (Which is normal) --

**But**, when you have children of a sprite, for example the `Life` and `Mana` labels, **they don't inherit the main controls theme**. Is that intended? If so, I apologize for this, I just thought all nodes under would inherit the main theme.

data.title: Using Division inside the float or decimal functions return unexpected results
data.body:
```
    print(float(0.25)) # This works fine, returns 0.25
    print(float( 25 / 100)) # Should be 0.25, returns 0
```

This bug **only happens when doing division**, float does work correctly **without division**

[Decimals ](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_@gdscript.html?highlight=decimals#class-gdscript-decimals) is a bit odd, too:

```
    print(decimals(0.25)) # Should be 0.25, returns 2
    print(decimals( 25 / 100)) # Should be 0.25, returns 0
```

data.title: Sprite Region Editor UI Space Bug
data.body: Not sure if this is intended, but when using the Sprite Region Editor you can hold down space to move around. But, **upon releasing space**, it automatically closes (submits the Ok Button)

data.title: Add breakpoint icon at script line number
data.body: it would be good to add breakpoint icon at script line number like in Delphi IDE or other game engine script editor and option to change color breakpoint line. Example: http://postimg.org/image/m99xzltip/

data.title: API reporting driver info
data.body: Proper implementation for #4352 - needed for debugging alternative rasterizers (ANGLE/MESA) for low-end PCs.

data.title: Game randomly crashes if extends GDscript file
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, compiled with 81fd4598c1e436c9dfe7951b1f829ff68045103b

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Game runs fine or randomly gets error one of following cases when run, if using `extends "some.gd"` ~~and `some.gd` has `func _init()`~~
- Runs fine
- Invalid call to function '_init'. Expected 6 (or random number like 528, 720896) arguments.
- Bug, call error: #1576692939
- Game Crashes without debug info

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Node2D (A.gd)
### A.gd

``` gdscript
extends "B.gd"
```
### B.gd

``` gdscript
extends Node2D
```

And run several times.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0ByuhCIzeus36TURzY3RBMnVULUk
